> Error: 
> java.lang.NullPointerException
>         at
> org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(AbstractSAXParser.java:996)
>         at com.gallup.g.LanguageHandler.load(LanguageHandler.java:109)


The words ".load" and "SAXParser" make me think of a classic ClassLoader 
problem.  Because you didn't mentioned which runner you were using, the 
question I have is:

- are you using the Swing application?

If you do, you should try the TextUI runner and see if you still have 
the same problem.  If the TextUI works fine, you have found the classic 
ClassLoader bug.  You can either stick with the TextUI runner or use the 
Swing runner with the "reload class" checkbox unchecked.

If it doesn't help, post more information about your specific configuration.

-Vladimir


PS: I would like to know (simple curiosity) if there is people out there 
using the Swing application with the "reload" off.  And why they find it 
better than the simple TextUI runner.  Please reply directly to me and 
not to the group.

-- 
Vladimir Bossicard
